_header: With this chanon I dwelt have seven year
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Canon’s Yeoman’s Tale of the Canterbury Tales — 762 lines in rhyming couplets.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
With this Chanoun dwelt haue I seven yereand of his science am I
                    neuer the nere…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…and there a poynt for endid is my talegod sende euery trewe
                    man bote of his bale
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…And next folwyng bigynneth his tale of philosophie (f. 225); the
                    Chanons yoman (RT); Here endith the Chanons yoman his tale… (f.
                        235v)

BodBar20.First Lines:
Sith this Chanonon dwelled haue I seuen ȝereAnd of
                    his science am I neuer þe Nere…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…And ther a poynt for endid is my taleGod sende euery trew man
                    bote of his bale
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
…and here bygynnyth þe tale (f. 172); yoman (RT); Here endith
                    þe yomans tale… (f. 180b)

Bod414.First Lines:
[W]ith this chanon duellid haue I this vij yerAnd of his science am
                    I neuer the nere…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…And ther a point for endid is my taleGod send euery true man
                    boot of his bale
Bod414.Attributed Title: The tale of the Chanons yoman (f. 120v)

BodHatDon1.First Lines:
WIth þis Chanon dwelt haue I seuen yereAnd of his sciens am I
                    neuer þe nere…
BodHatDon1.Last Lines:
…And þere a pointe for ended is my taleGod send eueri
                    true man bote of his bale
BodHatDon1.Attributed Title:
…And next / beginneth þe tale of the Chanons yoman (f. 144); The
                    Chanons yoman (RT); Here endeth the Chanons yomans tale… (f.
                    153)

BodLauMis600.First Lines:
…As on five or five vnces mai wel beOf siluer or of sum
                    oþer quantite…
BodLauMis600.Last Lines:
…And there apoynt for ended is my taleGod sende euery trew man
                    bote of his bale
BodLauMis600.Note:
VIII.720-55 lost (resupplied in the seventeenth century on f.
                        194v).

CULDd424.First Lines:
With this Chanon I dwelt haue seuene ȝereAnd of his science am
                    I heuere the nere…
CULDd424.Last Lines:
…And of bodies mollificaciounAnd also of here
                    induracion…
CULDd424.Note: Everything after VIII.855 lost in this MS.

The Chaucer Society

            1902).

CULGg427.First Lines:
…And besye me to telle ȝow the namysOf orpemynt brend
                    bonys Iren squamys…
CULGg427.Last Lines:
…And there a poynt for endit is myn taleGod sende euery trewe
                    man bote of his bale
CULGg427.Note: VIII.720-57 lost; 1046-7 omitted; 941 inserted at foot.
CULGg427.Attributed Title: Here is endit the chanounys manys tale… (f. 393)

BLHar1758.First Lines:
With this Chanoun dwellid haue I this 7 yereAnd of his science am I
                    neuyr the nere…
BLHar1758.Last Lines:

                    whiche I spake of a boue…
BLHar1758.Attributed Title: …And begynneth the tale (f. 145); The Chanounys yeman (RT)

BLHar7333.Attributed Title:

ChicagoUL564.First Lines:
Wyth þis Chanon I dwelled haue vij ȝereAnd of þis
                    science am I neuer þe nere…
ChicagoUL564.Last Lines:

                    wyl ȝow teche pleynly þe mateer…
ChicagoUL564.Note:
VIII.1058-1481 lost; 876-7 reversed; cathphrase on f. 195v:
                    ‘How I can wyrchen’. In the foliation, ‘186’ is repeated
                    and ‘189’ is omitted.

PhilRos10842.First Lines: …That can an hundrit fold more sotilte…
PhilRos10842.Last Lines: …And othir thingis wiche I shall tell more…
PhilRos10842.Note:
An 11-folio fragment: this leaf containing VIII.1091-167 of the
                        Canon’s Yeoman’s Tale. Part of the same MS as Manchester,  John Rylands Library Eng. 63 (‘Oxford Fragments’). VIII.1131 omitted.
PhilRos10842.Attributed Title:
…And be gynneth the tale (f. 122v); Here endeth the
                    secunde nonnes tale… (f. 127)

                    boote of his bale

                        81rb); Explicit fabula seruientis ca / nonici… (f.
                        81vb)
